results.title: Lore of the land (PC & MAC)
results.creator_credit: Adele Howard, Fraynework Multimedia and Multimedia 21 Fund - Cinemedia
results.brief_description: The land we live in shapes our lives and holds the story of our relationship with its vast mystery. This CD ROM is an invitation to explore and understand the Aboriginal love of the land. Take a journey through new cultural insights, Australian landscapes and Indigenous voices. It is designed to encourage us to live in harmony with each other and with the land we call home. SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS: Power Macintosh system 7.6.6 or later, 32MB RAM, 40 MB free HD space, 640 X 480 display (set to thousands of colours), 4 X CD ROM or better. IBM PC and Compatible: Pentium 200 or better, Windows 95 or later, 32MB RAM, 40MB free HD space, 640 X 480 SVGA display set to 16-bit colour (thousands), 4 X CD ROM. To run the videos on this CD ROM, you will need to instal Apple Quicktime Version 4 on your computer (contained on CD ROM).

results.title: Three Mile Creek (MAC)
results.creator_credit: Alyssa Rothwell and Department of Visual Communication, RMIT
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “RMIT Collection”.
This CD ROM is a collection of anecdotal accounts inspired by the experience of growing up in rural Australia. Music, dialogue and soundscape evoke the richness of the environment and create a sense of being there. A contemplative approach is the key to enjoying the stories. SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS: Recommended for use on a Power MacIntosh with a minimum of 15MB free RAM.

results.title: Orchids of Victoria
results.brief_description: Pictures many different varieties of orchids found growing wild in widely scattered parts of Victoria. Notes the differences among orchids and gives the common and botanical names as well as basic information about each variety.

results.title: Fashions, flowers and favourites
results.creator_credit: Syd Wood, Frank Killian, Movietonenews and Tourist Development Authority of Victoria
results.brief_description: Shows numerous scenes in and around Melbourne (1962?) including activities such as the Melbourne Cup, sailing on Albert Park Lake, eating out and nightlife, the Miss Australia judging, the Sidney Myer Music Bowl and the Royal Botanic Gardens. Commentry by David Low and Bert Bryant.

results.title: Melbourne: Australia's garden city
results.brief_description: This panoramic tour of Victoria’s capital provides the viewer with a vibrant snapshot of Melbourne and its surroundings. Highlights of the tour include: a trip on Melbourne’s famous trams, beautiful parks and gardens, historic landmarks Como House and Werribee Park, Cook’s Cottage in the scenic Fitzroy gardens, Old Melbourne Gaol, the Dandenongs and Puffing Billy, Marysville, Sovereign Hill, Ballarat and surrounds, the National Wool Museum at Geelong, Phillip Island and the tranquil bush surroundings of Healesville Sanctuary.

results.title: The Penguin Video
results.brief_description: Phillip Island, with its rugged coastline, windswept beaches and sparkling water, attracts over a million visitors a year. From all over the world people come to witness Australia’s famous Penguin Parade. Peter Hosking is your guide to Phillip Island, a haven for over 200 species of birds and wildlife, including koalas, kangaroos, wallabies, wombats and fur seals. As the sun goes below the horizon, the world’s smallest penguins gather off-shore in large groups, waiting for the safety of darkness. The stage is set. The first come ashore and the parade of the little penguins begins! Rated: G
